column45: Sometimes I searched for something and had no match - I was scrolling for a while thinking that it might be lower in the search results. column44: I liked being able to add related topics to the search to narrow it down and be reminded of some of the other topics. I also liked being able to see previews and snippets of things that might be relevant.
column45: I felt limited to not being able to just search something random. I wanted to be able to find "who first used the term sociology" but felt like it wouldn't have worked in the search engine. So instead I searched sociology and read about it in the preview which felt like it took longer than was necessary.
column46: I would have enjoyed the task more if I was able to see the questions when I was using the Semantic Chapter. I really enjoy those kind of comprehension questions where you have to find the answer and it would be interesting to do it in a search engine I'm not familiar with. I remembered a few of the terms and concepts I would be answering but I think it would have been a better test of the usability if I had the questions I needed answers to readily available.

column44: Easy search function, that seemed flexible. E.g. it always tried to find something related to a search term, as opposed to saying 'no results' simply if you got something slightly wrong in your search term.
